body:
Comment 53: 
Neither of those are blocking work on this.  In general the core developers have not
worked on Windows support.  It's been built by the community, and some of those people
are now committers themselves.  Nobody working on the core Go tools is likely to work on
this.

What this needs is somebody who understands how to modify the Go linker to optionally
generate a Windows object file instead of the Windows executable that it currently
generates.  This mostly means a different image header, and generating relocations.  The
work should not be particularly hard for somebody with a clear understanding of the
PE/COFF object file format.
